story:
Let me tell you the story of a dynamic sales professional whose career spans over 15 years. Our protagonist's journey began in 1997 with Edy's, where they led a team of drivers and sales agents across South Carolina and Georgia. Managing over 500 accounts, they helped grow the territory by 25% and oversaw a $10 million grocery business operation.

In 2002, armed with a fresh Bachelor's degree in Marketing from the University of South Carolina, they transitioned to a Sales Manager role at Wachovia Bank. Here, they mentored 10 Wholesale Account Managers and boosted loan sales by 30% in just six months.

The story takes an entrepreneurial turn in 2003 when they founded their own magazine publishing company. Starting from scratch, they built an impressive advertising base of 125 clients, including major brands like Harley-Davidson. Their publication grew from 5,000 to 60,000 copies quarterly in just one year, reaching as far as Japan and generating $500,000 in advertising revenue.

While running their publishing company, they also took on a role as Major Accounts Manager at Simplex Grinnell from 2007 to 2010, where they specialized in hotel vertical markets in Northern New Jersey, increasing market share by 25%.

Their most recent chapter was at the NY Daily News as a Digital Media Consultant from 2012 to 2014, where they ranked among the top five consultants. Throughout their career, they've been recognized with President's Club awards in 2004 and 2005.

Currently pursuing an MBA in Business Management at New Jersey Institute of Technology, this professional combines strong leadership skills, creative marketing strategies, and a proven track record of exceeding sales goals. Their story is one of continuous growth, adaptability, and success in building and maintaining strong client relationships across various industries.
